org.team4213.lib14

Class CowCamController<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team4213.lib14.CowCamController<T>

  • public class CowCamController<T>
extends java.lang.Object

    CowCamController is a very simple class that handles most of what one would do with a Camera. It reads the images and then runs a task upon them. The implementation is simple consisting of a few methods that one must deal with and is ready to handle multiple types of data using generics. It also uses Optionals to keep null at bay. Optionals also make it easy to not worry about the Task if one simply wanted camera reading functionality.

    The class manages

    • it's own running state
    • a VideoCapture instance
    • an Optional< Callable < T > >(the Task)
    • an Optional< Future < T > > to wait for the output of the Task
    • an Optional < T > to the actual output of the Task
    • a Mat for it's camera's latest image
    • and 2 ReadWriteLocks to prevent from issues with multiple threads

    Author:
    KrithikR

    • Constructor Detail

      • CowCamController

        public CowCamController(int cameraPort,
                        int fps,
                        java.util.Optional<java.util.concurrent.Callable<T>> imgProcess)
        Initializes a Camera Controller with a Port , Camera FPS , And an Optional Task to Run. The port and fps are int(s) whereas the Optional Task is a Callable
        Parameters:
        cameraPort - the integer to specify upon which port the Camera is
        fps - the integer to specify the frames per second of the Camera Read
        imgProcess - Optional> that runs on each Camera Read, which the output of can be retrieved by the getDataOutput method
        See Also:
        DriverStation, VideoCapture, Optional, Callable

    • Method Detail

      • getImgAsBytes

        public byte[] getImgAsBytes()
        Returns a Byte Array from the Camera's Image. This method is safe for usage by multiple threads.

        Summary
        Current implementation first sets the JPEG Quality to 500 in a MatOfInt called params ( short for parameters ). Then creates a MatOfByte called matByte to store the Image within. A lock is then set in place for the read and encode operation of the Camera's image. This operation also takes a filetype as a String ".jpeg" and the previously created parameters MatOfInt and matByte MatOfByte. The encode function fills the MatOfByte with the Image in the appropriate format according to the params and file extention. The lock on the image is then unlocked before returning the filled MatOfByte as a Byte[]

        Returns:
        byte[] created from the Camera's Image
        See Also:
        MatOfInt, MatOfByte, Highgui, ReadWriteLock

      • getImg

        public org.opencv.core.Mat getImg()
        Returns a Clone of the Camera's Image. It's implementation is meant to be thread safe.

        Summary
        The ReadWriteLock imageLock is first locked for reading before the latest image from the camera , camImage, which is a Mat is cloned and put into the newly created Mat called img. The lock is then unlocked and the cloned image (Mat) is returned.

        Returns:
        Mat that is a clone of the latest camera image
        See Also:
        Mat, ReadWriteLock

      • getDataOutput

        public java.util.Optional<T> getDataOutput()
        Returns the Output of the Image Processing Task. It's implementation is meant to be thread safe.

        Summary
        The ReadWriteLock dataOutputLock is first locked for reading. A new variable output of type T is then assigned to the existing variable called dataOutput that contains the output of the image processing task. Then the dataOutputLock is unlocked for reading and the T stored in output is returned.

        Returns:
        Object of type T that contains periodic output of the image processing task
        See Also:
        ReadWriteLock

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns the Current State of the Camera Controller. It is thread safe for reading and returns isRunning.
        Returns:
        boolean that represents the current state of the camera controller ( whether the camera is being read or not )

      • start

        public void start(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor)
        Adds a New Camera Read and Process Loop to the Inputted Executor and sets Running to True. The method handles the creation of a infinite loop that is run on a seperate thread pool created by an Executor.
        Parameters:
        executor - an ExecutorService that can be used to run the Camera Loop
        See Also:
        ExecutorService, readCamera(ExecutorService)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the infinite camera read and process loop running in the background.
        See Also:
        readCamera(ExecutorService)
